question: 下駄
sourceMnemonic: Look <kanji>below</kanji> you. These things carry your <kanji>burdensome</kanji> weight. All of it. These are the shoes you wear, though in this case they are specifically <vocabulary>geta</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>Japanese wooden clogs</vocabulary>. The clogs themselves are kind of burdensome and hard to wear too, actually, so you can think of it that way as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for <ja>駄</ja> is the secondary kanji reading. Instead of <ja>だ</ja> it's <ja>た</ja>. Hopefully you've heard of "geta" before. This will make it really easy for you to remember the reading of this vocab word.
